title: [Security] Path traversal: no validation on storage path, allowing writes outside intended
approach: Block parent directory traversal by rejecting paths containing '..' segments
commands_run: uv run ruff check src/flywheel/storage.py tests/test_minimal_framework.py
risks: Does not restrict absolute paths - users can still write to any absolute path if they have permissions
limitations: The fix blocks '..' traversal patterns but allows absolute paths (e.g., /tmp/file.json)
This is intentional to allow legitimate use cases while blocking path traversal attacks
